name: puppetlabs-glance
author: Puppet Labs
description: Puppet module to install and configure the Openstack Glance image service

properties.name: ensure
properties.doc:
The basic property that the resource should be in.

Valid values are `present`, `absent`.

properties.name: value
properties.doc: The value of the setting to be defined.

parameters.name: name
parameters.doc:
Section/setting name to manage from glance-api.conf

Values can match `/\S+\/\S+/`.

properties.name: ensure
properties.doc:
The basic property that the resource should be in.

Valid values are `present`, `absent`.

properties.name: value
properties.doc: The value of the setting to be defined.

parameters.name: name
parameters.doc:
Section/setting name to manage from glance-api-paste.ini

Values can match `/\S+\/\S+/`.

properties.name: ensure
properties.doc:
The basic property that the resource should be in.

Valid values are `present`, `absent`.

properties.name: value
properties.doc: The value of the setting to be defined.

parameters.name: name
parameters.doc:
Section/setting name to manage from glance-cache.conf

Values can match `/\S+\/\S+/`.

types.name: glance_image
types.doc:
This allows manifests to declare an image to be
stored in glance.

glance_image { "Ubuntu 12.04 cloudimg amd64":
  ensure           => present,
  name             => "Ubuntu 12.04 cloudimg amd64"
  is_public        => yes,
  container_format => ovf,
  disk_format      => 'qcow2',
  source           => 'http://uec-images.ubuntu.com/releases/precise/release/ubuntu-12.04-server-cloudimg-amd64-disk1.img'
}

Known problems / limitations:
  * All images are managed by the glance service.
    This means that since users are unable to manage their own images via this type,
    is_public is really of no use. You can probably hide images this way but that's all.
  * As glance image names do not have to be unique, you must ensure that your glance
    repository does not have any duplicate names prior to using this.
  * Ensure this is run on the same server as the glance-api service.

properties.name: ensure
properties.doc:
The basic property that the resource should be in.

Valid values are `present`, `absent`.

properties.name: id
properties.doc: The unique id of the image

properties.name: location
properties.doc:
The permanent location of the image. Optional

Values can match `/\S+/`.

properties.name: is_public
properties.doc:
Whether the image is public or not. Default true

Values can match `/(y|Y)es/`, `/(n|N)o/`.

properties.name: container_format
properties.doc:
The format of the container

Valid values are `ami`, `ari`, `aki`, `bare`, `ovf`.

properties.name: disk_format
properties.doc:
The format of the disk

Valid values are `ami`, `ari`, `aki`, `vhd`, `vmd`, `raw`, `qcow2`, `vdi`, `iso`.

parameters.name: name
parameters.doc:
The image name

Values can match `/.*/`.

parameters.name: source
parameters.doc:
The source of the image to import from

Values can match `/\S+/`.

providers.name: glance
providers.doc:
Glance provider to manage glance_image type.

Assumes that the glance-api service is on the same host and is working.

* Required binaries: `glance`.

properties.name: ensure
properties.doc:
The basic property that the resource should be in.

Valid values are `present`, `absent`.

properties.name: value
properties.doc: The value of the setting to be defined.

parameters.name: name
parameters.doc:

Values can match `/\S+\/\S+/`.
